explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of artificial neural networks (ANNs) and logistic regression models for forecasting stock market returns, which are machine learning techniques.
explanations.supervised learning: The paper uses ANNs and logistic regression for classification tasks, which are supervised learning methods.
explanations.unsupervised learning: The paper employs fuzzy c-means (FCM) for clustering, which is an unsupervised learning technique.
explanations.classification: The paper explicitly mentions using ANNs and logistic regression models for classification to forecast the daily direction of future market returns.
explanations.regression: The paper uses logistic regression models, which are a type of regression analysis.
explanations.clustering: The paper uses the fuzzy c-means method (FCM) to cluster preprocessed data.
explanations.principal components analysis: The paper applies principal component analysis (PCA) to reduce the dimensionality of the data set.
explanations.neural network: The paper uses artificial neural networks (ANNs) for classification tasks.
explanations.deep learning: The use of artificial neural networks (ANNs) can be considered a part of deep learning, especially if the networks have multiple hidden layers.
